intro: Odontoloma goudotianum, commonly known as the Goudot's toothed fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, toothed fronds that give it its common name. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces sporangia on the undersides of its leaves. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
